title: Trump administration to add roughly 65,000 H-2B guest worker visas this year
description: The Trump administration is releasing an additional 65,000 H-2B seasonal guest worker visas, nearly doubling the annual allocation. This move aims to alleviate financial hardship for businesses in sectors like hospitality and construction, which have reported labor shortages. The decision comes amidst broader immigration policies and follows similar visa expansions under previous administrations.

title: Delhi man critical after taking HIV preventive drugs on AI advice
description: A man in Delhi is battling a severe health crisis after taking HIV post-exposure medication without a prescription, guided by an AI chatbot. This reckless decision led to a rare and serious condition known as Stevens-Johnson syndrome.

title: Foul air causing deaths in India? 'Yes', 'can't say': 2 govt arms take differing stands
description: Divergent views from governmental bodies regarding air pollution are creating waves. The Environment Ministry argues that there's a lack of decisive evidence tying pollution to actual deaths, while the Indian Council of Medical Research puts forth alarming statistics, claiming over 1.2 million fatalities in 2017 due to air quality issues.

‘Border 2’ Box Office: Deol’s film leads with Rs 235 crore
description: The war epic 'Border 2' has achieved a remarkable feat, crossing the Rs 200 crore mark within its first week. Early estimates suggest an Rs 11 crore collection on its 8th day, pushing the total earnings to an impressive Rs 235.25 crores.  Despite facing competition from 'Mardaani 3', the film continues to draw audiences, with Jaipur showing strong occupancy.

title: From bricks to blockbusters: How CJ Roy turned Bengaluru’s fringe into fortune
description: CJ Roy transformed from managing his mother's real estate accounts to becoming a wealthy developer by betting on overlooked land along Sarjapur Road. This foresight, honed by early exposure to property transactions, led him to launch Confident Group and capitalize on Bengaluru's tech boom, achieving spectacular returns.

Epstein files: US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick planned visit to Jeffrey’s private island
description: Newly released Justice Department documents reveal Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick planned a 2012 visit to Jeffrey Epstein's private island, years after claiming to have severed ties. Lutnick inquired about visiting Epstein's island for a meal with his family and another family. The documents also indicate continued contact and shared interests between Lutnick and Epstein in later years.

'Mardaani 3' Box Office, day 1: Thriller opens with over Rs 3 crores
description: Mardaani 3 has kicked off its box office run with a respectable Rs 3.80 crore opening day. Rani Mukerji shines as the formidable cop Shivani Shivaji Roy, earning widespread praise for her powerful performance. The film, directed by Abhiraj Minawala, saw increasing audience occupancy throughout its first day, indicating a promising start for the franchise.

title: NGT asks authorities to fix falling native fish population in Yamuna
description: The Principal Bench of the NGT, comprising Chairperson Prakash Shrivastava and Expert Member A. Senthil Vel, also directed authorities to control pollution in the river, which is the main cause for the reduction of fish population.

2026 UGC equity rules: Cracks on campus
description: Students from the general category or upper castes believe that the UGC’s 2026 regulations, introduced mainly to address caste discrimination on campuses, will create a divide and villainise them. They worry about several of its provisions, including the lack of protection against false complaints. While the Supreme Court has stayed the regulations, anger has not yet subsided, report Abhinay Lakshman and Mayank Kumar

title: 'Gambhir under lot of pressure': Bavuma fires warning at India head coach
description: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma believes Indian coach Gautam Gambhir faces significant pressure in Test cricket, despite white-ball successes. Bavuma suggests Gambhir needs time to navigate the team's transition, with limited-overs strength potentially offering breathing room. He advocates for continuity in coaching roles, backing Gambhir through the challenging red-ball period.

title: After T20 World Cup exit, BCB reveals Shakib's roadmap for next ICC tournament
description: Bangladesh Cricket Board is planning Shakib Al Hasan's return to the national team.  The veteran all-rounder could play in the upcoming series against Pakistan.  Batting coach Mohammad Ashraful believes Shakib should aim for the 2027 ODI World Cup.  Shakib's personal security and legal issues are being addressed.  His comeback is a significant development for Bangladesh cricket.

title: Metal Meltdown: Silver, gold fall on profit taking, $ strength
‘Dear G’: Is Melania Trump mentioned in the Epstein files, and who is ‘G’?
description: Newly released Jeffrey Epstein investigation files reveal alleged email exchanges between Ghislaine Maxwell and Melania Trump from 2002. The correspondence, predating her marriage to Donald Trump, discusses a New York magazine story and travel plans. Neither the Trumps have been accused of any wrongdoing in connection with the Epstein case.

title: ‘I-T officials solely responsible for CJ Roy’s death,’ says Bengaluru real estate tycoon’s brother
description: Confident Group owner CJ Roy tragically died by suicide, with his family accusing Kerala income tax officials of causing immense pressure and harassment.  Roy's brother alleged repeated scrutiny despite his claims of compliance, leading to unbearable stress. The family plans to discuss filing a complaint against the officials involved.

title: Indian-origin printing firm boss convicted of COVID loan fraud in U.K.
description: Prashant Jobanputra is said to have “fraudulently declared” on the second application that this was the only Bounce Back Loan he had applied for.

title: NGT warns action against officers for lapses on curbing illegal mining
description: The NGT also directed the Director, Geology and Mining, Uttar Pradesh and the Member Secretary, UPPCB, to ensure that the directions given by the tribunal in other connected cases are strictly followed, and inspection is also carried out by an Expert Committee at least thrice for each lease

title: AI171 crash probe: AAIB assessing various aspects; nothing has been ruled out, says source
description: According to a report on January 30, the probe might be leaning towards deliberate pilot action as the probable cause for the accident

title: Epstein Files: Justice department temporarily removes document related to Trump and Jeffrey
description: The Justice Department briefly released and re-published a file containing FBI complaint summaries mentioning Jeffrey Epstein and Donald Trump.  These unverified complaints, some dating back 35 years, also referenced Bill Clinton and Lisa Marie Presley.  Notably, some complainants provided no contact details, and one email indicated second-hand information was included.

title: ‘No work, no school, no shopping’: Protests erupt across US against Trump's immigration crackdown
description: Nationwide protests erupted against the Trump administration's immigration policies, fueled by recent fatal shootings linked to enforcement.  Organizers called for a "no work, no school, no shopping" strike.  Hundreds gathered in Minneapolis, while schools in Arizona and Colorado cancelled classes. Businesses also participated, with some donating to immigrant support groups, highlighting widespread concern over the human impact of these policies.

title: Pawar play: Speedy decision on Sunetra as deputy CM to pre-empt takeover by NCP (SP)?
description: Sunetra Pawar's appointment as deputy chief minister is a strategic move by senior NCP leaders to preemptively quell leadership speculation following her husband's passing. This decision, endorsed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, aims to stabilize the political landscape before the potential merger of NCP factions, ensuring control amidst potential demands from Sharad Pawar's camp.

title: Maharashtra Zilla Parishad elections postponed to February 7: SEC
description: According to the SEC, the Supreme Court has allowed an extension of two weeks for these elections beyond January 31

title: 'Cops can't play role of judiciary': HC slams UP police on encounters
description: The Allahabad High Court has strongly criticized UP Police for frequent encounters, particularly below-the-knee shootings, citing a disregard for judicial authority.  Justice Arun Kumar Singh Deshwal mandated specific guidelines for all police-criminal encounters, emphasizing that punishment is the judiciary's role, not the police's.  Failure to comply will be treated as contempt.

title: India, Germany close to signing $8 bn P75I submarine deal, pact likely by March-end
Epstein files: Did Musk plan to visit Epstein’s private island? Here’s what new documents reveal
description: New documents reveal Elon Musk's communications with Jeffrey Epstein. Emails show Musk inquiring about visiting Epstein's island during the holidays. Epstein invited Musk, suggesting dates in early January. The documents indicate a level of contact previously unknown. Musk had previously stated he refused Epstein's invitations to the island.

title: Chloe Kim shares heartbreak as Myles Garrett stands by her side
description: The Cleveland Browns' star player, Myles Garrett, has been a strong source of support and strength to his girlfriend, the two time Olympian Chloe Kim, as she gears up for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Italy. While Chloe Kim seems fully focused on her prep, she ended up sustaining a brutal shoulder injury, just days ago. The popular 25 year old Olympian now opens up about her frustrations.

title: By March 31, transfer land for fencing of border: Calcutta HC to Bengal
description: The Calcutta High Court has ordered the Bengal government to transfer land parcels to the BSF by March 31 for fencing the India-Bangladesh border. This directive follows a PIL highlighting national security threats from unfenced border stretches. The court will also consider emergency land acquisition for pending proposals.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla's future is not in cars; names China as its only real rival
description: Elon Musk envisions Tesla's future beyond cars, shifting focus to humanoid robots. The company plans to convert Model S and X production lines into Optimus robot factories, aiming for a million units annually. Musk also identified China as the primary competitor in this burgeoning market, acknowledging their manufacturing and AI prowess.

title: Blazers vs Knicks injury report: Playing status, injuries & stats
description: The New York Knicks, on a four-game winning streak and near full strength, host an injury-plagued Portland Trail Blazers team struggling with a three-game losing skid.  Portland's depleted guard rotation faces a significant challenge against New York's size and defensive prowess.  Turnovers and execution are expected to be key factors in this Madison Square Garden clash.

description: The matter triggered a sharp political reaction, with the Trinamool Congress accusing the BJP of targeting a national sports icon

title: Kayla Nicole opens up as Taylor Swift–Travis Kelce wedding faces doubt
description: Travis Kelce's ex girlfriend, the popular social media influencer Kayla Nicole, has made a pretty emotional confession about her life as the Kansas City Chiefs' star player and Taylor Swift is reportedly planning to delay their wedding. At this point in time, Travis Kelce is facing strong retirement rumors while Taylor Swift is involved in a scandalous legal trouble with her Hollywood friends.

title: NHL trade rumors: Artemi Panarin seeks $50m extension, complicates talks
description: Star player Artemi Panarin seeks a massive $50 million contract extension. This demand complicates his potential trade from the New York Rangers. Several teams have expressed interest in acquiring Panarin. The Florida Panthers are reportedly a top choice for the player. Panarin is in the final year of his current contract. His future team will be decided soon.

title: Why was Kwesi Adofo-Mensah fired? Explaining the Vikings’ GM change
description: The Minnesota Vikings have surprisingly fired General Manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah after four seasons, despite a recent contract extension. The team cited "best interest of the team" for the leadership change following a disappointing 2025 season. Executive VP Rob Brzezinski will lead front office operations through the upcoming NFL Draft as the search for a new GM begins.

title: A soldier few know, a record few can match: Brigadier Henry Bhaskar’s journey through two wars and beyond
description: A frontline officer in the 1965 and 1971 wars, Brigadier Bhaskar went on to become the first chairman of the Chittagong Port Trust in newly liberated Bangladesh after leading Indian troops into the strategic harbour city

title: When the sea became a shared responsibility for scientists and people living along the coast
description: Over the past two decades, INCOIS’s Wave Monitoring Along Nearshore (WAMAN) buoy network has been transforming India’s coastal forecasting by combining science with community trust. With 17 nearshore buoys and active local participation, WAMAN delivers real-time wave data that strengthens early warnings, supports fishers and ports, and ensures long-term, sustainable ocean observation

title: Is Iran covering its nuclear sites? Satellite images reveal new activity at Natanz and Isfahan
Uttarakhand UCC amendment brings 7-year jail for forced marriages, live-ins
description: Uttarakhand's Uniform Civil Code (Amendment) Ordinance introduces stringent penalties, including up to seven years imprisonment, for offences related to marriage and live-in relationships. The amendments aim to clarify provisions, enhance effectiveness, and strengthen citizen rights, incorporating stricter punishment clauses following the implementation of new criminal laws.

description: Amazon HR chief Beth Galetti told employees the company won't announce mass layoffs every few months—though individual teams will keep making staffing "adjustments as appropriate." The careful wording follows 16,000 job cuts earlier this week and 14,000 in October last year. Company's top leadership framed the job cuts as part of CEO Andy Jassy's push to operate like the "world's largest startup," suggesting ongoing changes despite promises of no regular cuts.

title: 'Angoor khatte hai': Piyush Goyal rips into 'negative mindset' of Congress; pans UPA-era FTA deals
description: Union minister Piyush Goyal defended the India-EU FTA, dismissing Congress criticism as 'sour grapes' and highlighting the party's past inaction. He accused Congress of endangering India's interests by pushing for China-centric trade pacts, contrasting it with the current government's balanced approach. Goyal also lauded India's economic growth and the FTA's geopolitical significance.

title: Musk took final minutes of Tesla's earnings call to warn American companies about ...
description: Elon Musk issued a strong warning to American companies, urging them to invest in domestic battery manufacturing infrastructure or risk falling behind. He highlighted geopolitical risks associated with fragile supply chains for critical EV materials, emphasizing Tesla's own significant investments in lithium refining and battery production facilities in Texas to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

title: Panama court voids CK Hutchison port contracts: Why it's a win for Trump, setback for Xi
description: Panama's Supreme Court has voided a major Panama Canal ports contract held by a Chinese-linked firm, a significant win for the 'Donroe Doctrine'. This ruling aligns with US efforts to curb Chinese influence over strategic trade routes, complicating Beijing's global commercial footprint and reinforcing US leverage. The decision stems from alleged irregularities, though its geopolitical implications are profound.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up on nearly ending marriage over fertility struggles
description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.
